description: From Latin ōscillātus, perfect passive participle of Latin ōscillō (“swing”), from ōscillum (“a swing”), usually identified with ōscillum (“a little face or mask hung on a tree that sways with the wind”), diminutive of ōs (“mouth, face”).

verbs.description: oscillate (third-person singular simple present oscillates, present participle oscillating, simple past and past participle oscillated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To swing back and forth, especially if with a regular rhythm.
examples: A pendulum oscillates slower as it gets longer.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To vacillate between conflicting opinions, etc.
examples: The mood for change oscillated from day to day.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To vary above and below a mean value.
